physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 26-month-old boy presented with a cyst in the left hepatic lobe measuring 19 cm. At 4 years 9 months, a 2-cm nodule in the right thyroid was resected and diagnosed as follicular adenoma. Five nodules in the left thyroid lobe were diagnosed as benign nodules after fine-needle aspiration over 9 years.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The initial cyst was large and removed, but multiple recurrent cysts were noted afterward, leading to a hepatic lobectomy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Magnetic resonance imaging revealed a 14-mm solid liver tumor with enclosed tiny cysts.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By 39 months of age, the lesion became polycystic and increased to 6.6 cm. At 75 months of age, significant regression of the hepatic cyst was noted.
